skill.name: nextjs-devtools
skill.description:
Next.js development tooling via MCP. Inspect routes, components, build info, and debug Next.js apps.
Use when working on Next.js applications, debugging routing, or inspecting app structure.
NOT for general React or non-Next.js projects.
skill.summary: Next.js development tooling via MCP. Inspect routes, components, build info, and debug Next.js apps....
skill.author: Asmayaseen

security_audit.summary: Legitimate Next.js development tool. Uses subprocess.Popen to spawn MCP servers (intentional design for stdio transport), HTTP requests to local MCP endpoints (standard MCP protocol), and shell scripts for server startup. All capabilities match the stated purpose. The static analyzer flagged 'weak cryptographic algorithm' on 38 locations - these are false positives from misidentified Python builtins (str, len, list, set, type). The skill-report.json previously audited this as low risk with no confirmed malicious patterns.

high_findings.title: subprocess.Popen for MCP server spawning
high_findings.description: StdioTransport class spawns MCP servers using subprocess.Popen with shell=True. This is intentional design for a universal MCP client that needs to launch servers based on user-provided commands.
high_findings.reasoning: Legitimate MCP connectivity pattern. shell=True required for compound commands. Caller controls the command string, which is expected for MCP client usage.

content.value_statement: Next.js development requires visibility into routes, components, and build configuration. This skill provides MCP-based tools to inspect your Next.js app structure, debug routing issues, and examine build settings directly from your AI assistant.
actual_capabilities: List all app routes in a Next.js project
Get detailed information about specific routes
Discover and list React components in the app
limitations: Requires Next.js project structure to function
Does not modify or edit files
Build info requires running next build first

use_cases.title: Debug routing issues
use_cases.description: List all routes and check their configurations when routes are not behaving as expected.

use_cases.title: Inspect API routes
use_cases.description: Review API route handlers and their structure to understand backend endpoint organization.

use_cases.title: Component exploration
use_cases.description: Find and catalog React components across the application for refactoring or review.

prompt_templates.title: List all routes
prompt_templates.prompt: Use list-routes to show me all routes in this Next.js application.

prompt_templates.title: Check specific route
prompt_templates.prompt: Use get-route-info with route parameter to check the /api/users endpoint.

prompt_templates.title: Debug build config
prompt_templates.prompt: Use get-build-info and get-config to check my Next.js build settings.

prompt_templates.title: Find components
prompt_templates.prompt: Use list-components to show me all React components in this application.

output_examples.input: Use list-routes to show me all routes in this Next.js application.
Use list-components to show me all React components in this application.

best_practices: Run from the root directory of your Next.js project
Execute next build before checking build information
Use specific route paths with get-route-info for detailed information
Combine tools like list-routes then get-route-info for comprehensive debugging
anti_patterns: Running in a plain React project without Next.js structure
Expecting component discovery to work before the app is built
Using tools without being in a Next.js project directory
Relying on build info without first running next build

faq.question: What is Next.js DevTools?
faq.answer: An MCP-based tool that provides visibility into Next.js app structure including routes, components, and build config.

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires an MCP-compatible environment.

faq.question: What can I inspect?
faq.answer: App routes, route details, React components, build configuration, and next.config.js settings.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads project files locally. No data is sent to external servers beyond the MCP protocol.

faq.question: Why are no routes found?
faq.answer: Ensure you are running from a Next.js project root. Run next build first for complete build information.

faq.question: How is this different from React DevTools?
faq.answer: This tool inspects the project structure and build configuration at the file level, not runtime component state.
